name: ListRulesets
description:
Retrieve a list of all rulesets from PagerDuty.

This tool retrieves all rulesets, which are used to route events to endpoints and define actions based on event contents. Note that rulesets and event rules will soon be deprecated, and it is recommended to migrate to Event Orchestration. Use this tool to access existing rulesets until they are phased out.

parameters.name: accept_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version using the `Accept` header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify 'application/json' to set the content type for the API request.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of ruleset results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The starting point for pagination in search results. Use this to skip a specific number of results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: include_total_count
parameters.description: Set to true to include the total count of results in the response. By default, this is omitted for speed. Refer to the Pagination Docs for details.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.
